page.title: 01THE PRESTON AREA
page.content: The area covered is rural and contains 2 small villages and several hamlets. Much of the land belongs to 2 large estates,the Pilkington estate and the Bowes Lyon estate.There are several farms,mainly arable but with some dairy cattle and a few sheep.There are many wooded areas and this provides cover for the pheasants which are reared locally for the shooting season There are no large rivers,just the source of the R.Mimram to the far south and there are few hills to climb The landscape is gently undulating and very peaceful and pleasant.Only lanes and country roads cross the area and there are just 3 pubs, 4 churches and 1 shop.People travel to nearby Hitchin or Stevenage to shop and work and many residents commute to London each day. The total population is a few hundred. e
